Fields.DialogueText: This was a terrible idea.
But she's cute.
Arguing with yourself, Kapitän? Das ist das Zeichen eines schwachen Geistes.
Insulting me in German does not make it any less of an insult.
I'm just stating the facts. Anyway. Can I ease your mind?
Not in the slightest. What's that you've got there?
Eine Reitgerte.
A... riding crop?
Dog crop. It's a pretty thing, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: You have a reason for carrying one of those around?
There isn't a dog for miles around.
Are you gonna use that thing on me?

Fields.DialogueText: Do you *want* me to?
There doesn't need to be.
Do I ever do anything without reason?
Der Führer carries one of these little beauties. I thought I would try to emulate his example.
(Good grief.)
It's for self-defense. When the movement was young, it had many enemies. There were legendary beer hall battles.
And he never *started* any of those fights?
Only the ones he could win.
*ALARM*
Let's emulate his example.
Do let's *not*.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, do you have a second? I'd like to spend some time with you.
It's pretty late... but I always have a second for you, Val.
Good. Here, take this-
Your camera? I thought you didn't want people touching it.
You are not people. Here- let me adjust my uniform.
Are you... unbuttoning it?
What's the matter, Kapitän?
I just. Well.
This is a lot of trust you're giving me, all of a sudden.
You're trusting me to take, uh, boudoir photos of you...
You would like to, eh? Nein, I just readjust the unifo. Or should I stop?
... I don't really trust myself to say. Everything that's happened since you handed me the camera feels kind of dreamlike. I keep coming back to the word "trust."
Ja, I trust you with all of me, body and soul. And my camera is a part of me.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what to say.
Aren't you all about clean and sober living?
Feeling particularly self-destructive today, are we?

Fields.DialogueText: What makes you say that?
Theoretically, someone could use these to blackmail you.
You'd never do something like that.
I am! But- this is different.
Is it really?
... Of course it is!
Then don't say anything. Take the picture.
*ALARM*
You'd better button back up.
Jawohl. Let's finish them quickly. --And give me back my camera.
Right. Don't want you to miss your glory-hounding.
@BATTLE
Oh, you've got the gramophone going again. More Wagner?
Ja. Ich versuche, mein Herz mit nordischem Mut zu füllen! -- And the Ritt der Walküren helps me become brave.
You've got no shortage of bravery.
When it comes to glorious battle? Absolut. When it comes to writing letters? That's a little more difficult.
Oh, that's right. You got a letter from the Kriegsmarine last week. I thought it was just about your photos.
Nein, nein. We're going to be passing by the German coast soon. A few of our admirals are proposing we host a dinner.
They would attend - UND they would extend the invitation to der Führer.

Fields.MenuText: ... Good grief.
And you're writing them to accept?
You really think I could stand to be in the same room with that man for five minutes?

Fields.DialogueText: If politeness dictated it, yes.
Better to ask your forgiveness than your permission.
Why the sour face? This is *exciting.*
... I have an honest question. Would this make you happy?
I would reach a state of... perfekten Freudentaumel!
Overjoyed. Got it.
... If this would really make you *that* happy, I'll sign off on it. But...
But what?
... Don't expect *me* to be happy about it.
Braver Hund. I'll have you trained yet.
What the actual-
*ALARM*
Come, Kapitän. We have more important things to attend to.
I hope you got enough bravery from your Wagner to cover this.
More than enough.
@BATTLE
Oh, you... borrowed another one of my books.
*Die Verwandlung*, ja.
Oh, Kafka's Metamorphosis. How are you liking it?
I hate it. Widerlich!
Why am I not surprised.
It's so neurotic. To be expected from a Slavic author. But...
But what?
It has some insights. The good family that tolerates Gregor until they finally see him as the vermin he is-
Wait. No. Gregor was still Gregor the whole time. He was still human in his-
Papperlapapp! This is where you see the weakness of the Slawischen Autorentums: he felt the need to invoke empathy with the vermin. Er hat es zum Opfer stilisiert.
... You've never met any of the harder-hit veterans of the last war. It puts empathy for people in distress in a less abstract perspective.
Ugh. I am just glad that his sister puts him out of his misery. He's too degenerate to live by the end.
That's one way to read it.
... You really meant to compare... the vermin to veterans?

Fields.MenuText: Anyway, I think it's kind of a metaphor.
I don't know. Maybe it's just me.
Maybe it happens to everyone sooner or later.

Fields.DialogueText: It won't *ever* happen to me! I'm *not* unclean. I keep myself pure as snow.
... Do you feel like that? -- Wait, what am I saying?
Mmm. Your feelings can still eat you alive.
A metaphor for *what*?
Angst. Shell shock. Melancholy. Feelings that eat you from the inside-out.
If you're a strong person, you shouldn't have those feelings.
"Shouldn't." You keep using that word.
And you don't?
*ALARM*
Stations, people, we got company!
Now is the time for "should," nicht wahr?
@BATTLE
Oh, hush.
More the kind of... psychological detachment Gregor suffers, maybe. I've seen people who had a hard time fitting in to society after traumatic experiences. Doesn't even have to be war, I suppose.
Hold this for me, Kapitän.
A box of records?
Ja. Just for a moment, while I fix the gramophone...
Dum de dum, dum de dum...
Into the sleeve it goes, and... here.
You can put the box down now, Kapitän.
Braver Hund! So obedient.
Are you... calling me a good *dog*?
Aber ja! I told you I would train you, nicht?

Fields.MenuText: What the actual-
I didn't ask to be *trained*.
Mm... Why do I feel like this goes along with the riding crop?

Fields.DialogueText: Spare me the swearing, Kapitän.
Ich habe dir gesagt, ich würde dich trainieren. You didn't notice when I said it?
Bad dogs get punished. Good dogs get a treat.
I-
*ALARM*
--We'll talk about this later. Stations, people!
@BATTLE
So uh. About this *training*.
Was stimmt damit nicht?
I didn't ask to be *trained*. I'm not a dog.
You are a very loyaler Begleiter, Kapitän. Besides...
The stronger one in any pair should take the lead.

Fields.MenuText: That would be me.
The *short leash* doesn't match my *rank*.
I would have liked this *if you had asked me first*.

Fields.DialogueText: And your blood is unbecoming of the Ubermensch. But here we are.
Pah, sei doch nicht albern!
And that is exactly why *I didn't need to ask*.
I don't want you to *train* me. I need you to stop. *Now.*
Make me.
What?
If you're stronger, then *force* me to stop. Command me. Make it stick.
I-
Dacht ich mir.
*ALARM*
We have more important things to worry about now. Komm, Hund.
Stop calling me that. That's an order.
Jawohl, Kapitän. --I may slip.
If you do, I'll make you regret it.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, quick! Take these!
What... ?
Oh, these are the books you borrowed.
Not so loud!
Damit kann ich nicht gesehen werden! They're- They'll think I'm-
Corrupt. Filthy. Eine Kriminelle.
... Are you *wiping off your hands?*
I don't want to even think about touching them again! Especially if der Führer is coming.

Fields.MenuText: You think knowledge is a communicable disease?

Fields.DialogueText: This knowledge might as well be. It's-

Fields.MenuText: It's not like I gave you the *dirty* books.

Fields.DialogueText: Schlimmer geht immer.

Fields.MenuText: ... You really think he's going to come?

Fields.DialogueText: Warum nicht? I'm the pride of the Kriegsmarine. Named after our Fatherland. Natürlich he'd want to see me in Aktion!
It's *wrong*, knowing what they think.
If you *want* things to get worse, I'm happy to loan them out.
I'm sure he'd like to, but don't you think he has other things to do?
... They said he might come.
Under no circumstance!
If you say so.
*ALARM*
Ah, ein Platz where I kann be seen in Aktion.
@BATTLE
The guests of honour are about to dock. Bist du aufgeregt?
"Aufgeregt"... do you mean "excited", or "nervous"?
Both, Kapitän. In my case, at least.
*You're* nervous?
I want to make a good first impression. I've corresponded with both these Admirals before, but...
Und natürlich,, there's der Führer to consider! We can't be any less than our very best!
-- Stop making that face. They're coming.
Aber - ich verstehe nicht- Why are there only *two*-
Heil Hitler!
Sieg heil! Schön sie zu sehen, aber--
We'd been told to expect more guests.
Es gab einen Vorfall im Norden. We're the only ones who could spare the time for a social call.
Also... der Führer... Er ist nicht...?
No. He sends his regards.
....I see. Richten Sie ihm bitte meinen herzlichsten Dank aus.
... Kapitän. Deutschland has told me a lot about you.

Fields.MenuText: Is that so?
Only good things, I hope.
Well, we are very close.

Fields.DialogueText: I am not sure whether that speaks worse of you or her.
We all wish that were the case.
Ja. She had a lot to say.
*ALARM*
Bitte prüfen Sie mich auf Herz und Nieren, Admirale! Let's show them what I can do, Kapitän!
We will watch with *interest*.
@BATTLE
You run a tight ship, Kapitän.
Thank you.
Your crew's so disciplined. It's a minor miracle.

Fields.MenuText: I treat them well, so they're loyal to me.
We've had a lot of practice. The Morganas don't stop.
Everyone knows what they need to do. I just get them there.

Fields.DialogueText: They never do. But that is not why I'm surprised.
It's a miracle you can make them move at all.
Hm. Personal loyalty does go a long way.
Your crew's wretched.
Can you repeat that, Admiral? I think I must have misheard.
Poor blood, poor breeding, mongrels of all nations.
Zu wahr. It's a disgrace to my name, isn't it?
(... For her sake, I've got to keep my mouth shut.)
*ALARM*
Wir sehen uns wieder in Aktion.
Jawohl. Come, Kapitän.
Braver Hund.
I told you not to do that. -- Why are you praising me?
You didn't spew degenerate nonsense. It's progress.
... We can't afford to argue this now. Come on.
@BATTLE
The League really has crippled us with its crew mandate, hasn't it?
Mm. I can't believe the trash they allow aboard. It's sickening.
Lesser races running around on *all* our ships. Verdammt, der Funker ist Jud-
Deutschland! A word?
Ein Wort.
We need to talk privately.
... Ah. Entschuldigen Sie mich bitte, Admiral.
Du bist entschuldigt.
Sieg heil!
Is this the part where you berate me, Kapitän?
This is the part where I tell you I ought to send you to the *brig*.
For speaking the truth? Such *tolerance*.
For disregarding a direct order.
You *need* to be able to get along with my crew. *Regardless* of what you think of them.
If they were your ex-lover or your arch-nemesis, you'd still need to get along with them. Because they are your *crewmates*.
I *am* putting up with this Mannschaft.
I am already *clumsy* and *inefficient*. I do not need an inferior crew dragging me down!

Fields.MenuText: That is a matter of opinion.
You'll just have to get better to compensate, won't you?
It doesn't matter, because *you need to follow orders.*

Fields.DialogueText: ... Jawohl. But-
What do you think I've been doing this entire time?!
It is an opinion our superior officers share.
Ah. Yes. About them.
I just want to impress my superior officers!
But what?
But I really don't see how talking with our superior officers honestly about this crew violates your orders.
... I can't chastise you in front of them. I've been holding back this entire time, because I don't want you to...
... I don't want you to lose your name.
... I appreciate that.
... I can't stop you if you join in their conversation. I'm not going to overtly punish you while they're here. But as your captain...
*ALARM*
I understand. Let's deal with the bigger problem.
*THWACK*
Ah, your crop. I thought you might use it on me.
Only if you didn't give me what I wanted.
@BATTLE
If the Admirals left *today*, it'd be too soon.
... I'm so exhausted and she's so...
We can't do anything less than our best!
Der Führer might still come, and-
... Yeah., maybe I'll walk around the deck.
*sigh*
... You know, it's funny. I thought the longer I was with her, the more I'd...
I don't know, be able to... get her to calm down? Get her to accept her own crew? Almost every other Belle in the fleet can't help but be loyal to her people. I thought it was part of being a Belle.
But no, the longer we go on, the worse it gets.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I should break things off.
Maybe I should give up trying to change her.
Maybe we'll just... take it a day at a time.

Fields.DialogueText: ... But how many days can I keep taking it?
... But... no, that's not...
... As long as she believes in her 'Struggle'... I can't... feel good about...
... But that doesn't...
... I don't want to just...
... She needs *someone* in her corner, even if it's...
DU! Geh mir aus dem Weg! Und fass mich nicht an!
... Aaaaand she's making another mess I'll have to clean up.
Why do I put myself through this...?
*ALARM*
I guess the fact that we're still managing to do some good is a factor.
@BATTLE
Putting up flags, I see?
Heil Hitler, Kapitän! Aber natürlich.
We have honoured company, and might have even more if the situation resolves itself. Of course I'm going to decorate for the occasion.
Val...
Nenn mich nicht so! -- Not where other people can hear.

Fields.MenuText: You realize he's not coming, right?
That's a *lot* of flags.
... You don't have to try so hard.

Fields.DialogueText: I have to compensate for the Dreck that the Flotte gave us.
Danke schön. I made them myself.
... You never know, Kapitän. I'm going to act as if he is.
That's what I was afraid of.
This again? Ugh.
That must have taken a long time.
... I kind of hate that flag.
*How?!* It's a masterpiece of modern design.
It makes you feel small, doesn't it? It overshadows everything for a mile around.
Ist das nicht der Punkt? The Partei is bigger than you or me. It makes you feel like you're a part of something greater.
Maybe. But I don't like it. It feels like you're being watched.
Genau, watched over like a Schaf by its good Hirte.
*ALARM*
I'm going to take that crop away from you, so help me.
You'd fight me instead of the Morganas? Schäm dich was!
I am not a sheep and the Nazi Party is no shepherd.
*THWAP*
Böser Hund.
@BATTLE
You need to *stop*.
What do I "need to stop"? So vague.
... You're never going to convert me to your worldview and you're never going to convince our *guests* that you're perfect.
You are trying *far* too hard and it's hurting *both* of us.
I fail to see how *I'm* getting hurt. And *you* wouldn't be if you'd *behave* yourself.
I shouldn't have to *behave!* I didn't ask to be your goddamn *pet*, Val!
But you're so good at it.
Look- that isn't even the *point* of this conversation.
Sondern?
You and I are in a relationship that should imply a degree of mutual respect. I don't like giving you orders unless it *directly* relates to work - and even then I try to be clear-headed.
And yet you've been ordering me around like a servant.
I trust you to know what's best for our mission, what's best for our crew, and what's best for you.
That should tell you how bad things have gotten.
You don't trust me.
I *want* to. I *want* to say that this - this *pushing* everyone, it isn't like you.
We both know that would be a lie.

Fields.MenuText: It would. You push yourself too hard.
When you're upset, you bully the other crew members. That's not right.

Fields.DialogueText: ... And when you push yourself, you push the crew. And you push hard.
It's not *bullying.* I push myself as hard as my crewmates.

Fields.MenuText: And I don't like lying to you, Val.

Fields.DialogueText: You're doing it right now.
Have you considered that maybe that's part of the problem?
I push exactly as hard as I need to.
What? How?
*ALARM*
Ich muss etwas töten. Are we done here?
...Yes. Kill all the Morganas we can reach. Just keep my crew out of your drama.
*Your* crew?
@BATTLE
I have decided to delay the Diner.
What?
Just a few more days. Maybe when this crisis is dealt with, we can have *all* my guests aboard.
This again? He's not coming, Val.
Diese Gewissheit. Are you going to set yourself up as a fortune-teller?
... No, and I'm not a mind-reader either. It's just *that* obvious.
Nein, nicht wirklich. Unless you're making some assumptions.
If any of your guests wanted to be here, don't you think they would have sent more than two admirals?
You invited half the Kriegsmarine. And no one came.
*Now* you're just being cruel for the sake of cruelty.
That's *rich*. Coming from *you*.
I wish I could say it isn't like *you*.
Are we really doing this? You're acting like a child.
You started it.
I didn't *start* anything. You *hit* me.
Because you needed a lesson!
I wanted to think it could be different. Because you *care* about what I think.
Du bist genau wie die anderen -
... You want to walk that back?
Do you want me to lie?

Fields.MenuText: I want you to see what's going on!
Say what? I went a little deaf for a second there.
Oh, for God's sake.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you know how crazy you sound right now? I wouldn't be *striking* you if I didn't *care-*
Bullshit.
My point-
... Stop pretending to be kind. You don't care how you act towards me and we both know it.
You want me to give up all my standards because they're inconvenient to you and your INPF scheme!
Fine. If we're not being *kind*-
I'm just like "die anderen?" Which "anderen?" Which others am I like?
... If it isn't obvious, I won't say it again.
... You mean your superior officers, don't you?
Du wirst mich noch zum Trinken treiben.
*ALARM*
We'll drink together after this. You can even have water.
...Hah. Still pretending to care.
If you think I'm pretending, it's your loss.
@BATTLE
... You weren't joking about that drink?
No. Here, give me your drinking horn.
... This has got to be the freshest water I've ever tasted. Where's it from?
The Alps.
Ah, I should have realized. Es schmeckt nach Vaterland.
... You invited me here. You talk first.
... I want to know what you meant when you said I was "like the others."
I don't want to abuse my power over you. And I want you to feel... as safe as possible. Considering the circumstances.
So if something's up... I want to know what it is.
... Du weißt es wirklich nicht?
If I knew, I wouldn't be asking.
... I thought you could be overpowered... or killed with kindness. But you're just like the rest of them.

Fields.MenuText: There has to be more to it than that.
I don't understand. I'm easy to impress. And your performance *in battle* has been impressive.
You don't have to overpower me, Val. We're equals here.

Fields.DialogueText: ... What more can I say? If you cannot understand my position, you're a bigger idiot than I thought.
Danke. But we both know I have a hero's spirit.
Das ist die größte Lüge, die ich je gehört habe.
... So what are you so worried about? Your performance has been excellent this entire time.
I thought I understood it.
I know, I know, you don't believe in equality. But it's the truth.
Verdammt, Kapitän! Kannst du nicht sehen, wie du mich ängstigst?
I... *scare* you?
You could take my name. And you've been trying to do that this entire time.
You keep saying that you're not. But then you try to fill my head with garbage. You try to make me weaker.
You want me to be unworthy of my name.
... Deutschland is not the Reich.
... I love you, Deutschland. Even with... everything that's happened. I want you to be yourself.
But I want you to be the best version of yourself you can be. I want you to be *happy*. And right now, you're not.
Of course I'm happy! Or I would be, if you weren't trying to-
Trying to-
*ALARM*
DAAAAAAAAAH! Können wir nicht eine Sekunde Ruhe bekommen?
I thought fascists didn't like peace.
Schieb es dir in deinen gottverdammten Arsch.
@BATTLE
... I wish it was easier to stay mad at her.
Kapitän! Do you have a moment?
Why?
I need your Kunstverstand.
You're asking me for help? After we fought?
I have looked at this so often that I cannot see what is in front of me anymore.
Lost in the woods, huh? Fine. Show me.
Sieh her!
Oh, a display of your photographs?
Ja. I need help - which of these is most impressive?
I simply can't decide between this sinking Nixe, this Explosion, and this shot of the Mannschaft.

Fields.MenuText: The explosion is striking.
The sinking Morgana is powerful.
The shot of the crew is my favourite, but...

Fields.DialogueText: ... I took it for you, Kapitän.
And *I* love it. But Freeman and Cohen are in the back there. You might catch hell from your admirals.
... Verdammt. I didn't notice.
I think so, too. It really shows the might of the Reich. Through my guns and my camera!
I love the play of light along the edge of it, don't you?
Mm! It hits the water nicely, too.
... It sure does.
Danke. I'll put this in the place of honour...
Deutschland? What are you doing?
Heil Hitler, Herr Admiral! I'm finishing the decorations!
... Hm. Lassen Sie sich davon nicht ablenken.
Natürlich nicht.
*ALARM*
And now I can prove it.
@BATTLE
Respectfully, you couldn't distract her from fighting the enemy if you tried.
It's almost time. How do I look, Kapitän?
You look like a Valkyrie. As ever.
Danke! I feel auch like one.
This dinner will be a legendary battle.
Heh. I thought I was the only one who felt like that.
... He might still come. A few more people have shown up.
... You don't mean Herr Hitler, do you?
Ja. ... It's a childish dream. But I want to meet my hero. Don't we all?

Fields.MenuText: They say you should never meet your heroes.
I've met one of mine. It was humbling.
I'd rather eat broken glass than meet your hero.

Fields.DialogueText: Wenigstens bist du ehrlich.
I'm always honest with you.
Oh, tell me!
Charlie Chaplin. Remind me to tell you about it sometime.
They need to pick better heroes.
Isn't he a Jude? Das ist ja widerlich!
*ALARM*
Typisch Nixe always visits as ungebetener Besuch!
If we hurry, you can get a picture while you're still in your dress uniform.
Oh! Lass uns gehen!
@BATTLE
Sieg Heil! Ich hoffe, dass alles nach Ihrem Geschmack ist.
Es sieht lecker aus.
Puh! I'm glad you like it.
The smoked fish looks as well prepared as anything I've seen since the start of the war. Und sogar Kaffee, too...
I made a special effort to get the very best, Herr Admiral.
Mmm. We'd have it more often if there weren't so many useless eaters in the world...
Genau. The food shortages are bad enough with the Nixen.
And with the British trying to blockade us, at that.

Fields.MenuText: The Endeks... this was Poland? And the "undesirables" were Jews, I take it?
Well, that's appalling.
... Can't we have some cheerier dinner table conversation?

Fields.DialogueText: In these times, I'm not sure how possible that is.
It *was* a ridiculous idea. Sending every undesirable to an island is a bad enough plan, but when it's one halfway across the world?
It's a happier conversation than the death rolls. A plan like that? Hah.
You say "Poland" like it was a true state. Aber you have the basics, as I understand them.
... Isn't Madagascar a French colony?
I suppose some enticements were under consideration.
The Nixen would make it impossible for us even if we did have say over Madagaskar.
With how things have been going, maybe it's time we begin to consider more practical solutions. For all Europe!
... Are you implying what you think I'm implying?
We can't support a population of traitors. If we can't kick them to the curb...
Well, we need to be realistic and fearless in our thinking.
I don't *disagree* with you, but there's no *crisis* yet. We can consider other approaches.
*skrrt*
Kapitän? Where are you going?
*Out.*
The Morganas sure complicated that one.
Aber the Admiral is quite correct. The problem is within our own borders as well. Subversive elements who consume our resources and corrupt is in return.
I heard the Endeks looked into sending some of their undesirables to Madagaskar, even before we stepped in.
Looks like everything's just about ready for the big meal.
... It really can't be over soon enough.
*ALARM*
Good. I needed this.
@BATTLE
Was in Hels Namen sollte das alles?!
What was that about? What was that about?!
You think I wanted to sit there and listen to you and your - your *friends* euphemistically dance around *crimes against humanity*?! Over dinner?!
They're not - We weren't-
That was disgusting. Even by your standards.
I stuck my neck out for you!
What are you talking about?!
I disagreed with my direct superior. Because I could tell you were getting uncomfortable.
So you thought I'd want to hear you argue for delaying mass deportations? Maybe restricting the Reich to just *reasonable* mass murder? Is that it?
Ich- I-
Will I ever be ENOUGH for you?
... What?
You've already corroded my morals. You've corrupted me. You're taking away everything I believe in and everything I care about.
And now you have the *gall* to tell me that I disgust you?
... You know what I need from you.
And you know I can't give it to you!
Val-
Don't call me that!
*THWAP*
I hate you! I hate you-
*THWAP*
I'd have to be- I'd have to be someone completely different, and-
Stop. Hitting. Me.
*SNAP*
You broke my crop!

Fields.MenuText: I'll break worse if you hit me again.
You were beating me with it.
It was self-defense.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Jawohl.
That didn't mean you had to- had to-
Yes, it did.
... I'm going to walk away, before I do *anything* either of us will regret.
Don't follow me.
Ich hatte es nicht vor.
*ALARM*
Oh, dammit.
@BATTLE
Did it get cold in here, or is it just me?
Mm? ...Oh, Kanchou just came in.
The look our Belle's giving him... brr. I don't like it one bit.
It feels like Okaa-san and Otoo-san are fighting, doesn't it?
A little. At least they've been avoiding each other these last few days.
I can't wait til we get those admirals off the boat. Maybe things will go back to normal.
Maybe. But I wouldn't count on it.
Why's that?
... Did you hear some of the things they've been yelling about?
I heard nothing.
*ALARM*
All right, people! Let's move! These Morganas won't fight themselves.
Are you coming or not, Deutschland?
Ich hole meine Kamera.
I think the Captain's finally grown a spine. And she doesn't like it.
You can take pictures after the battle. Come on.
@BATTLE
Kapitän. You wanted to see me?
I did. Sit down.
... Are you endlich going to punish me now?
Punish you?
... I assumed you were waiting for the Admirale to leave.
Why wouldn't you punish me?
... At this point? What good would it do?
I beat you with a crop. I deserve to be punished.

Fields.MenuText: It feels wrong to subject you to formal discipline over a lovers' quarrel.
What could I even do to you? Put you in the brig? You'd teleport away.
If you want a formal punishment, it'd be more painful not to give you one.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Sie sind so schlau wie immer, Kapitän.
I know, I'm a canny bastard.
I'd stay there. Versprochen, Kapitän. Mach mit mir, was ich verdiene.
Das war nicht nur ein Streit zwischen Liebenden.
You're right that it was more than that.
I won't subject you to formal punishment. But...
... That doesn't mean that your actions will have no consequences.
Danke den Göttern.
For example-
*ALARM*
Verdammt!
I'm starting to think the Morganas eat hard conversations.
Die Nixen fressen alles. Let's finish them so we can finish this.
@BATTLE
I just realized...
Mm?
... you never disciplined me.
Let's get the stragglers.
Schon dabei! Just let me get my Kamera-
@BATTLE
I know you've said the idea makes you uncomfortable, Kapitän - but I deserve to be remonstrated for the ways I let you down. Both for my outburst at you....
... Yes?
... And for... putting you in that situation to begin with.
... Go on.
... I know you don't... approve of my ideology.

Fields.MenuText: That's an understatement.
You're too good for it. I have to believe you'll see that for yourself someday.
No. And it's hard for me to hold my tongue, even for your sake.

Fields.DialogueText: Natürlich. It's hard for me to hold mine when you start preaching weakness at me.
Das Gefühl beruht auf Gegenseitigkeit. We're too alike, aren't we?
Hah! Ja, das habe ich erwartet.
... I wanted to meet my heroes. I didn't get to. And I wound up putting you in a situation where... I couldn't protect you.
I don't need your *protection*. I need you to not hurt me. There's a difference.
Ich schätze da hast du Recht.
... Let's finish our private conversation.
All right. To my cabin, then?
Right behind you.
So. Konsequenzen.
Yes. ...All right.
First: no more crop. No more 'self-defense' weapons. You get one, I confiscate it.
Ich verstehe, Kapitän.
Glad you understand.
... The last one's harder.
I don't want you to touch me.
Until I can trust that you won't touch me in anger... I don't want you to touch me at all.
Aber wir sind Liebhaber-
I know we're lovers. I know. This is going to be hard.
... But I don't feel *safe* anymore.
Second- no more training. If you give me a command, I'm going to ignore it. If you tell me I'm a good dog, I'm going to ignore *you*.
... Again, understandable.
You remember how you said, before, about your camera... that you trusted me with your body and soul?
I still do.
I used to. But you tried to break my body with your crop and my soul with your training.
... I feel as violated as you would if I dropped your camera overboard.
... That... I understand. I didn't realize the training was that... painful. I didn't realize you were so zerbrechlich.

Fields.MenuText: I told you a few times. You didn't listen.
If you had, would you have stopped?
In another life, I might have liked it. If you *asked* me.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I thought I had no choice.
... I thought you were exaggerating.
... I thought as much. You seem like the type.
What's *that* supposed to mean?
Nichts, gar nichts.
You *always* have a choice, Val. And you chose to hurt me.
... There's one other thing.
Would I lie to you about something this serious?
Was ist?
... A Walküre may choose her Kapitän.
... Where are you going with this?
I can't and won't force you to pick someone else. But ... you might consider it.
... Ich verstehe. If I have broken you so schwer...
*ALARM*
Fantastisch! Mir ist grad wirklich zum Töten zu Mute.
You need to kill something? I'm just glad it isn't me.
@BATTLE
... Say. I just realized something.
Schon wieder?
At the dinner-
Don't make me think about that night. I can't stomach it.
All right.
Sag schon! ...Bitte?
When the admiral was feeling you out about doing God knows what to the "undesirables" and you talked about holding off... was that for me? Or do you believe what you said?
It's a waste.
What?
... I can't tell what disgusts me more. Schmutz like that walking among us... or wanton destruction of manpower at a time we need it most.
... If you've taught me anything, Kapitän, it's that even the scum of degenerate races have their part to play.
We have an ocean full of Nixen and a two-front war to win. We need every pair of hands we can get. Good, evil, clean, dirty, it doesn't matter.
... Pragmatic as ever. I see.
Would you rather I be an ideologue about it?

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely not.
I *have* corrupted you.
I just want you to be happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Stop lying. If you wanted me to be happy, you'd stop poking my beliefs.
... Hah. And you're going to keep doing it, aren't you?
Then I will be pragmatic. And we will have *some* common ground.
Until the end of time.
*ALARM*
I'll stop poking as soon as I see a sign that they actually *do* make you happy.
What we should zerstören willkürlich, sind Nixen.
Another thing we can agree on.
@BATTLE
Kapitän... Eine Frage.
Ask away.
Are we through?
... How do you mean?
...You do not want me to touch you. You do not want to be mein Kapitän anymore.
Are we still lovers? Or are we... through?
... I guess it depends.
Worauf?
... I need time. *You* need to get your head together.
... If we can get to a point where I feel safe around you again outside of battle, and you feel safe around me? Then I would want to stay with you.
... After everything I've done to you? You'd still want...?

Fields.MenuText: I love you. Of course that's what I want.
... I'm trying to forgive you. It's the right thing to do.
To be blunt? I don't think I'll ever feel safe with you again.

Fields.DialogueText: Das ist mehr als fair. I have treated you horribly.
...In your shoes, I would not have.
Ich liebe dich auch.
... So what happens now?
... We both take some space to breathe. Figure out ... what we want out of this. What's acceptable. What's not.
... And after that? We talk. We figure things out.
... I don't deserve you at all.
You deserve a hero. If no one else will take the job...
Danke. But you're not going to save me from myself.
That's not what I want.
Then what-
*ALARM*
... Hah. At this rate, we'll never get the chance to reflect. Much less talk.
No rest for the wicked. Val?
Ja?
... I don't want to save you. I want to save *us*.
... That's what I want, too. But I don't know....
*BOOM*
I know one thing- no one's going to get "saved" if the ship goes down.
Let's defend each other, then. Für den Ruhm!
... I don't think we're hopeless. In battle, we're as good together as we ever were.
Perversely enough, I actually do trust you when our lives are on the line - and I think *you* trust *me* then too.
Natürlich!
Maybe that's what makes everything else so complicated. When we're good together, we're saving the world.
